DOC.HEAD: Child Whose Family Drove Off Without Him Reunited with Parents
DOC.TEXT: A 5-year-old Texas boy was accidentally left at a service station when his family got back on the highway and didn't noticed his absence until stopping for dinner two hours later. ``This is embarrassing, but I'm glad he's safe,'' said his father, Glenn Payne. ``We've all had a scare this evening.'' Tyler Payne got out of the family's station wagon to use the restroom Friday afternoon, then couldn't get out of the building because the door had become stuck. Meanwhile, his family headed for Texas. Two hours and over 100 miles later, his parents, five brothers and a sister stopped at a restaurant in Jackson, Tenn., and noticed Tyler was missing. Back in Nashville, Tyler had been freed by a woman who heard him shouting. The boy spent the next few hours with detectives, who amused him with teddy bears, coloring books and candy. The Paynes had spent Christmas with Kris Payne's parents in Knoxville and were on their way home to Weatherford, Texas, when they stopped at the service station. ``We normally have a head count, but this time we didn't,'' Payne said. ``We were tired.''
